attributes.comment:
Adoption is expensive enough already, and it is unconscionable to raise fees by
up to 66% for adoption-related petitions. American citizens living abroad and
adopting internationally already face significantly higher costs than those
living in the US; for example, notarization must be done at consulates or
embassies, which often requires long-distance travel. The changes in fees
proposed in USCIS-2006-0044 will only serve to make international adoption less
of an option for people of moderate means, and will place an undue burden on US
citizens living overseas.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Daphne Katranides
